definition: Difficulties or misfortune.
mnemonic: Adversity sounds like 'adverse-city,' indicating a city (or situation) full of challenges.
visual_representation: Picture a person struggling against strong winds and storms, symbolizing facing adversity.
example_sentence: She showed great resilience in the face of adversity.

definition: To deceive someone by pretending to have a stronger position or more resources than one actually has; a steep cliff or bank.
mnemonic: Bluff sounds like 'bluffing,' indicating pretending or faking something.
visual_representation: Imagine a poker player pretending to have a winning hand, symbolizing bluffing.
example_sentence: He managed to bluff his way through the negotiations.

definition: Cautious or wary; reluctant to do something.
mnemonic: Chary sounds like 'char-y,' as if carefully choosing your actions, like picking the right 'char' in a game.
visual_representation: Picture someone carefully crossing a rickety bridge, symbolizing being chary.
example_sentence: She was chary of investing in the new business venture.

definition: An act of attacking or plundering.
mnemonic: Depredation sounds like 'depredate,' indicating destruction or plundering.
visual_representation: Imagine a group of bandits raiding a village, symbolizing depredation.
example_sentence: The depredation of the countryside by the invading army left the villagers homeless.

definition: To fill someone with wonder and delight, holding their entire attention.
mnemonic: Entrance sounds like 'enter trance,' as if putting someone in a spellbinding state.
visual_representation: Picture a magician captivating an audience with a mesmerizing performance, symbolizing entrance.
example_sentence: The children were entranced by the magician’s tricks.

definition: Recklessly bold or rash.
mnemonic: Foolhardy sounds like 'fool-hardy,' indicating someone who is foolishly daring.
visual_representation: Imagine someone jumping off a high cliff into unknown waters without thinking, symbolizing foolhardiness.
example_sentence: It was foolhardy to go hiking in the mountains without proper gear.

definition: Causing repulsion or horror; grisly.
mnemonic: Gruesome sounds like 'grew-some,' indicating something that grows in horror or disgust.
visual_representation: Picture a crime scene with blood and gore, symbolizing something gruesome.
example_sentence: The movie was so gruesome that many people left the theater.

definition: To subject someone to aggressive pressure or intimidation.
mnemonic: Harass sounds like 'her-ass,' as if persistently bothering or troubling someone.
visual_representation: Imagine someone being constantly pestered by others, symbolizing harassment.
example_sentence: The employee filed a complaint after being harassed by her colleague.

definition: Beginning to happen or develop.
mnemonic: Incipient sounds like 'in sip-pient,' as if something is just taking a small sip or starting out.
visual_representation: Picture a tiny sprout emerging from the ground, symbolizing something incipient.
example_sentence: The incipient stages of the project showed a lot of promise.

definition: A person who makes slow progress and falls behind others; slower than desired or expected.
mnemonic: Laggard sounds like 'lag-gerd,' indicating someone who lags behind.
visual_representation: Imagine a runner trailing far behind the rest in a race, symbolizing a laggard.
example_sentence: The laggard failed to meet the deadline, delaying the entire project.

definition: An optical illusion caused by atmospheric conditions, especially the appearance of a sheet of water in a desert or on a hot road; something that appears real or possible but is not in fact so.
mnemonic: Mirage sounds like 'mirage image,' indicating an illusion that deceives the eye.
visual_representation: Picture a traveler in the desert seeing a pool of water that isn’t actually there, symbolizing a mirage.
example_sentence: The oasis turned out to be a mirage, disappearing as we got closer.

definition: Lack of experience, wisdom, or judgment; innocence or unsophistication.
mnemonic: Naiveté sounds like 'naïve-tay,' indicating innocence or a lack of worldly experience.
visual_representation: Imagine a child trusting everyone they meet, symbolizing naiveté.
example_sentence: Her naiveté led her to believe everything he said without question.

definition: To stare at in a lecherous or flirtatious manner.
mnemonic: Ogle sounds like 'ogle eyes,' indicating staring or gazing at someone with strong interest.
visual_representation: Picture someone staring at another person with obvious attraction, symbolizing ogling.
example_sentence: He couldn’t help but ogle the model as she walked down the runway.

definition: To carry out or commit (a harmful, illegal, or immoral action).
mnemonic: Perpetrate sounds like 'per-pet-rate,' indicating committing or carrying out an act.
visual_representation: Imagine someone committing a crime, like robbing a bank, symbolizing perpetration.
example_sentence: The crime was perpetrated by a group of masked men.

definition: To provide or give (a service, help, etc.); to cause to be or become; to make.
mnemonic: Render sounds like 'send-er,' as in sending or providing something.
visual_representation: Picture a doctor rendering medical assistance to a patient, symbolizing providing help.
example_sentence: The judge rendered a verdict of not guilty.

definition: Badly made or done; of poor quality.
mnemonic: Shoddy sounds like 'sho-ddy,' indicating something poorly made or inferior.
visual_representation: Imagine a cheaply made piece of furniture falling apart, symbolizing shoddy workmanship.
example_sentence: The shoddy construction of the building led to its early collapse.

definition: To carry, move, or convey from one place to another; a strong emotion or state of being overwhelmed by emotion.
mnemonic: Transport sounds like 'trans-port,' indicating moving something across distances or being moved emotionally.
visual_representation: Picture goods being loaded onto a truck for delivery, symbolizing physical transport, or someone being swept away by music, symbolizing emotional transport.
example_sentence: The music transported her to a place of peace and serenity.

definition: Not able to be maintained or defended against attack or objection.
mnemonic: Untenable sounds like 'un-ten-able,' indicating something that cannot be held or defended.
visual_representation: Picture a crumbling wall that can no longer support itself, symbolizing an untenable position.
example_sentence: His argument was so weak that it quickly became untenable.

definition: Speech or writing that uses too many words or excessively technical expressions.
mnemonic: Verbiage sounds like 'verb-age,' indicating an excessive use of words.
visual_representation: Imagine a page filled with dense, overly complex text, symbolizing excessive verbiage.
example_sentence: The report’s verbiage made it difficult to understand the main points.

definition: Having or showing a feeling of vague or regretful longing.
mnemonic: Wistful sounds like 'wish-full,' indicating a yearning or longing for something.
visual_representation: Picture someone looking out of a window on a rainy day, deep in thought, symbolizing wistfulness.
example_sentence: She gave a wistful smile, remembering the days of her youth.
